subject: RE: [junit] Newbie to JUNIT
msgSnippet: Dear Tashi, From the information you have provided, it looks like this is not a JUnit specific error.  I ask you to try a few things to help track this down: -
messageBody:
Dear Tashi,

From the information you have provided, it looks like this is not a JUnit specific error. I ask you to try a few things to help track this down:


- Cut and paste the code from your test into a main method (minus any assertions or other JUnit-specific code). Do you still get this error? Be sure to run any accessors that are only run in the assertions! Be sure also to run this from Eclipse using the same JVM as you use for your JUnit tests.

- Do you have a special build process that needs to be repeated for this test class? I'm not familiar with JNI (which I am assuming you are using), but it is possible that you are not deploying either a library file or including certain dynamic classes in your module.

Let's see where that takes us,

Rocco

From: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com] On Behalf Of tashi garg
Sent: Tuesday, June 16, 2009 8:22 AM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [junit] Newbie to JUNIT





Hi,
I am using our custom API for code development that has lots of native methods.
While I am running JUNIT test case in eclipse to test a simple test case, I am getting such error:

java.lang.UnsatisfiedLinkError: constructor
at abc.ui.xyz.api.constructor(Native Method)
at abc.ui.xyz.<init>(Unknown Source)
at GC.<clinit>(GC.java:30)
at CT.testCollisionGrid(CT.java:70)

How can I change the API to rectify it.

Please help.

Thanks



[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
